DOC.brief_summary: The study test hypothesis AccuCath™ System high rate successful first attempt peripheral intravenous ( IV ) placement , high completion therapy , few complication , longer dwell time , high user satisfaction compare conventional IV catheter .
DOC.brief_title: AccuCath Guidewire Intravenous ( IV ) Device Versus Conventional IV Catheter In General Nursing Use
DOC.detailed_description: This study design evaluate user/physician preference relates use 510 ( k ) clear vascular access catheter device compare conventional needle/catheter vascular access device , term first stick success rate , dwell time , device-related vascular complication adverse event overall user patient satisfaction . As noted , study design formally test hypothesis AccuCath™ System exhibit superiority term rate successful first attempt peripheral IV placement , high completion therapy , few complication , longer dwell time high user satisfaction compare conventional intravenous catheter .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female , age ≥ 18 year ≤ 89 year old ; 2 . Capable willing give inform consent ; 3 . English speaking ; 4 . Acceptable candidate elective , nonemergent peripheral intravenous ( PIV ) catheter placement determine order physician ; 5 . Admitted study inpatient unit . 1 . Male female , < 18 year old > 89 year old ; 2 . Requirement emergent IV placement ( patient 's condition would compromise delay IV placement ) ; 3 . Previous venous graft surgery target vessel access site ; 4 . Currently involve investigational clinical trial ( unless permission grant study principal investigator [ PI ] ) ; 5 . Females pregnant , plan become pregnant within 3 month procedure , lactate .
DOC.keyword: First Attempt Success Rate IV Catheters
